intro: Clidemia naudiniana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Clidemia naudiniana is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it an invasive species in some areas.
